trans-unit.source: Recipes

seg-source.mrk: Recipes

trans-unit.source: Each recipe is contained in the Recipe Header page. In this page, users can maintain the percentage of the division of ingredients (raw materials) for the manufactured items.

seg-source.mrk: Each recipe is contained in the Recipe Header page.
In this page, users can maintain the percentage of the division of ingredients (raw materials) for the manufactured items.

trans-unit.source: : Recipe Header for item P-10002, Panel

seg-source.mrk: : Recipe Header for item P-10002, Panel

trans-unit.source: General FastTab

seg-source.mrk: General FastTab

trans-unit.source: The fields on this FastTab are described in the following table.

seg-source.mrk: The fields on this FastTab are described in the following table.

seg-source.mrk: Field

trans-unit.source: No.

seg-source.mrk: No.

trans-unit.source: Unique identifier for the recipe.

trans-unit.source: Description

seg-source.mrk: Description

trans-unit.source: Description of the recipe.

seg-source.mrk: Description of the recipe.

trans-unit.source: Unit of Measure Code

trans-unit.source: Unit of measure to which the recipe refers.

seg-source.mrk: Unit of measure to which the recipe refers.

trans-unit.source: Status

seg-source.mrk: Status

trans-unit.source: Indicates the current processing state of the recipe. The options are:

seg-source.mrk: Indicates the current processing state of the recipe.
The options are:

trans-unit.source: New – The recipe is new.

seg-source.mrk: New – The recipe is new.

trans-unit.source: Certified – The recipe is certified and ready for use.

seg-source.mrk: Certified – The recipe is certified and ready for use.

trans-unit.source: Under Development – The recipe is in progress.

seg-source.mrk: Under Development – The recipe is in progress.

trans-unit.source: Closed – The recipe has been closed.

seg-source.mrk: Closed – The recipe has been closed.

trans-unit.source: Search Name

seg-source.mrk: Search Name

trans-unit.source: Populated from the Description field, can be modified as needed without affecting the Description field.

seg-source.mrk: Populated from the Description field, can be modified as needed without affecting the Description field.

trans-unit.source: Version Nos.

seg-source.mrk: Version Nos.

trans-unit.source: Version number series to which the recipe versions refers.

seg-source.mrk: Version number series to which the recipe versions refers.

trans-unit.source: Active Version

seg-source.mrk: Active Version

trans-unit.source: Displays the number of the active recipe version, if one exists.

seg-source.mrk: Displays the number of the active recipe version, if one exists.

trans-unit.source: Last Date Modified

seg-source.mrk: Last Date Modified

trans-unit.source: Date the production structure was last modified.

seg-source.mrk: Date the production structure was last modified.

trans-unit.source: Max. Incorporation %

seg-source.mrk: Max.
Incorporation %

trans-unit.source: Defines a limited quantity of incorporation item in this recipe that is created from a production structure. This field contains the maximum percent share of incorporation item relating to the entire recipe.

seg-source.mrk: Defines a limited quantity of incorporation item in this recipe that is created from a production structure.
This field contains the maximum percent share of incorporation item relating to the entire recipe.

trans-unit.source: Lines FastTab

seg-source.mrk: Lines FastTab

trans-unit.source: In the recipe line, the Item Type field distinguishes between:

seg-source.mrk: In the recipe line, the Item Type field distinguishes between:

trans-unit.source: Share of Recipe – an item entered in percent or proportion.

seg-source.mrk: Share of Recipe – an item entered in percent or proportion.

trans-unit.source: Item – an item that can be entered in component-value and unit of measure.

seg-source.mrk: Item – an item that can be entered in component-value and unit of measure.

trans-unit.source: Due to this, it is possible to maintain in the recipe not only items with percentages but also to enter, for example, the packaging.

seg-source.mrk: Due to this, it is possible to maintain in the recipe not only items with percentages but also to enter, for example, the packaging.

trans-unit.source: Recipe lines can be calculated using the following methods:

seg-source.mrk: Recipe lines can be calculated using the following methods:

trans-unit.source: Share % – total shares must equal 100 percent.

seg-source.mrk: Share % – total shares must equal 100 percent.

trans-unit.source: Shares – total share amounts must equal 100 and automatically calculate the percentage in the Share % field when the recipe is certified.

seg-source.mrk: Shares – total share amounts must equal 100 and automatically calculate the percentage in the Share % field when the recipe is certified.

trans-unit.source: Quantity per – absolute values.

seg-source.mrk: Quantity per – absolute values.

trans-unit.source: Refer to online help for more information about the other fields on this FastTab.

seg-source.mrk: Refer to online help for more information about the other fields on this FastTab.

trans-unit.source: Copy BOM Function

seg-source.mrk: Copy BOM Function

trans-unit.source: On the Actions tab, click Copy BOM to copy lines from existing production BOMs/recipes into the current recipe. When complete, all necessary changes can be made.

seg-source.mrk: On the Actions tab, click Copy BOM to copy lines from existing production BOMs/recipes into the current recipe.
When complete, all necessary changes can be made.

trans-unit.source: Navigate Tab

seg-source.mrk: Navigate Tab

trans-unit.source: Click the Navigate tab to access actions specific to the entire recipe.

seg-source.mrk: Click the Navigate tab to access actions specific to the entire recipe.

trans-unit.source: Action

seg-source.mrk: Action

trans-unit.source: Description

seg-source.mrk: Description

trans-unit.source: List

seg-source.mrk: List

trans-unit.source: Opens a list of all recipes.

seg-source.mrk: Opens a list of all recipes.

trans-unit.source: Comments

seg-source.mrk: Comments

trans-unit.source: Displays comments for the selected recipe. Comments are for internal use only; they are not used on any documents.

seg-source.mrk: Displays comments for the selected recipe.
Comments are for internal use only; they are not used on any documents.

trans-unit.source: Versions

seg-source.mrk: Versions

trans-unit.source: Opens the list of recipe versions for the selected recipe. Versions allow users to create different versions of a recipe which is useful if changes should be documented. Every version of the recipe can have a unique start date in the header and a unique start and end date in the lines.

seg-source.mrk: Opens the list of recipe versions for the selected recipe.
Versions allow users to create different versions of a recipe which is useful if changes should be documented.
Every version of the recipe can have a unique start date in the header and a unique start and end date in the lines.

trans-unit.source: All production orders that start after the start date of a recipe are linked to the corresponding version of the recipe. It is possible to create two versions of one recipe with the same start date. In this case, the correct version can be chosen over the production order lines.

seg-source.mrk: All production orders that start after the start date of a recipe are linked to the corresponding version of the recipe.
It is possible to create two versions of one recipe with the same start date.
In this case, the correct version can be chosen over the production order lines.

trans-unit.source: Matrix per Version

seg-source.mrk: Matrix per Version

trans-unit.source: Opens the Prod BOM Matrix per Version page, which enables users to compare all versions of a recipe.  This page provides an overview of all components on one or more layers and shows the percentile shares of recipe components.

seg-source.mrk: Opens the Prod BOM Matrix per Version page, which enables users to compare all versions of a recipe.
This page provides an overview of all components on one or more layers and shows the percentile shares of recipe components.

trans-unit.source: Where-used

seg-source.mrk: Where-used

trans-unit.source: Shows where a recipe is used in a production structure. Single and multilevel features are helpful for maintenance or troubleshooting. The multilevel feature displays all effected BOMs.

seg-source.mrk: Shows where a recipe is used in a production structure.
Single and multilevel features are helpful for maintenance or troubleshooting.
The multilevel feature displays all effected BOMs.

trans-unit.source: Ingredients

seg-source.mrk: Ingredients

trans-unit.source: Opens the Production BOM Header Ingredients page, which displays the sum of recipe ingredients (refer to topic “Ingredients Management” on page 1).

seg-source.mrk: Opens the Production BOM Header Ingredients page, which displays the sum of recipe ingredients (refer to topic “Ingredients Management” on page 1).

seg-source.mrk: Incorporation Items

trans-unit.source: Allows users to determine the incorporation items for this recipe (refer to topic <MadCap:xref href="Incorporation.htm#_Ref234728134" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">“Incorporation” on page 1</MadCap:xref>).

seg-source.mrk: Allows users to determine the incorporation items for this recipe (refer to topic <MadCap:xref href="Incorporation.htm#_Ref234728134" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">“Incorporation” on page 1</MadCap:xref>).

seg-source.mrk: Recipe Comparison

trans-unit.source: Opens the Recipe Comparison page (refer to topic “Recipe Comparison” on page 1).

seg-source.mrk: Opens the Recipe Comparison page (refer to topic “Recipe Comparison” on page 1).

seg-source.mrk: Recipe Search

trans-unit.source: Opens the Recipe Search page (refer to topic “Recipe Search” on page 1).

seg-source.mrk: Opens the Recipe Search page (refer to topic “Recipe Search” on page 1).

seg-source.mrk: Lines FastTab, Component Menu

trans-unit.source: On the Lines FastTab, click the Component menu to access menu items specific to the recipe line.

seg-source.mrk: On the Lines FastTab, click the Component menu to access menu items specific to the recipe line.

seg-source.mrk: Where-Used

trans-unit.source: Shows where the selected recipe line is used in a production structure.

trans-unit.source: Ingredients

seg-source.mrk: Ingredients

trans-unit.source: Opens the Production BOM Line Ingredients page for recipe lines with ingredients (refer to topic “Ingredients Management” on page 1).

seg-source.mrk: Opens the Production BOM Line Ingredients page for recipe lines with ingredients (refer to topic “Ingredients Management” on page 1).

trans-unit.source: Line Texts

seg-source.mrk: Line Texts

trans-unit.source: Opens the Edit Text page where special text can be added for the selected recipe line or existing text can be viewed or edited (refer to the current “cc|text module” documentation).

seg-source.mrk: Opens the Edit Text page where special text can be added for the selected recipe line or existing text can be viewed or edited (refer to the current “cc|text module” documentation).

trans-unit.source: Multilevel Recipes

seg-source.mrk: Multilevel Recipes

trans-unit.source: In the production structures, different items or recipe shares can be entered or a new main recipe can be added. If a user enters a recipe as the main or base recipe, it can be selected in the production structure.

seg-source.mrk: In the production structures, different items or recipe shares can be entered or a new main recipe can be added.
If a user enters a recipe as the main or base recipe, it can be selected in the production structure.

trans-unit.source: : Main recipe used on production structure

seg-source.mrk: : Main recipe used on production structure

trans-unit.source: If the production structure is used in production, the lines of the main recipe are transferred to the production order component lines and are divided accordingly.

seg-source.mrk: If the production structure is used in production, the lines of the main recipe are transferred to the production order component lines and are divided accordingly.

trans-unit.source: : Components of the main recipe

seg-source.mrk: : Components of the main recipe

trans-unit.source: This makes it possible to use a main recipe that is only a part of an overall recipe.

seg-source.mrk: This makes it possible to use a main recipe that is only a part of an overall recipe.

trans-unit.source: For example, an overall recipe has a main recipe of 90% and a color share of 10%. Therefore, the components of the main recipe are divided to 90% of the entire recipe and the color share holds the remaining 10%.

seg-source.mrk: For example, an overall recipe has a main recipe of 90% and a color share of 10%.
Therefore, the components of the main recipe are divided to 90% of the entire recipe and the color share holds the remaining 10%.

trans-unit.source: Using a main recipe is helpful because it only needs to be configured once. For example, if the raw materials change, they are used in all new production orders.

seg-source.mrk: Using a main recipe is helpful because it only needs to be configured once.
For example, if the raw materials change, they are used in all new production orders.

trans-unit.source: Change Recipe

seg-source.mrk: Change Recipe

trans-unit.source: With the “Change Production BOM No.” function, the used production BOM for released production orders can be changed even if a finished quantity was posted.

seg-source.mrk: With the “Change Production BOM No.” function, the used production BOM for released production orders can be changed even if a finished quantity was posted.

trans-unit.source: : Released Production Order with partially finished quantities

seg-source.mrk: : Released Production Order with partially finished quantities

trans-unit.source: On the Lines FastTab, click Line > Change Production BOM No. The Production BOM List page appears, from which a new production BOM can be selected.

seg-source.mrk: On the Lines FastTab, click Line > Change Production BOM No.
The Production BOM List page appears, from which a new production BOM can be selected.

trans-unit.source: Note

seg-source.mrk: Note

trans-unit.source: To run the “Change Production BOM No.” function, the Allow Product Design Change in Prod. Order Line check box must be selected on the Process Manufacturing Setup page.

seg-source.mrk: To run the “Change Production BOM No.” function, the <span class="Bold">Allow Product Design Change in Prod.
Order Line check box must be selected on the Process Manufacturing Setup page.

trans-unit.source: : Production BOM List with new BOM selected to be transferred to production order line

seg-source.mrk: : Production BOM List with new BOM selected to be transferred to production order line

trans-unit.source: After selecting the new production BOM, or recipe, the quantity of the existing production order line is set to the finished quantity and a new production order line is added and calculated.

seg-source.mrk: After selecting the new production BOM, or recipe, the quantity of the existing production order line is set to the finished quantity and a new production order line is added and calculated.

trans-unit.source: : Released Production Order with new Production BOM line

seg-source.mrk: : Released Production Order with new Production BOM line

trans-unit.source: The order tracking of the remaining quantity is transferred to the new production order line. Existing reservations attached to the old production order components are transferred.

seg-source.mrk: The order tracking of the remaining quantity is transferred to the new production order line.
Existing reservations attached to the old production order components are transferred.

trans-unit.source: : Prod. Order Components on the new Production BOM line

seg-source.mrk: : Prod.
Order Components on the new Production BOM line
